children.name: text
children.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
children.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

children.name: contained
children.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

children.name: target
children.formal: The resource(s) that were generated by  the activity described in this resource. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity.

children.name: period
children.formal: The period during which the activity occurred.

children.name: recorded
children.short: When the activity was recorded / updated
children.formal: The instant of time at which the activity was recorded.

children.name: reason
children.formal: The reason that the activity was taking place.

children.name: location
children.short: Where the activity occurred, if relevant
children.formal: Where the activity occurred, if relevant.

children.name: policy
children.short: Policy or plan the activity was defined by
children.formal: Policy or plan the activity was defined by. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

children.name: agent
children.short: Person, organization, records, etc. involved in creating resource
children.formal: An agent takes a role in an activity such that the agent can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place. An agent can be a person, a piece of software, an inanimate object, an organization, or other entities that may be ascribed responsibility.

children.name: role
children.short: e.g. author | overseer | enterer | attester | source | cc: +
children.formal: The role that the participant played.

children.name: type
children.short: e.g. Resource | Person | Application | Record | Document +
children.formal: The type of the participant.

children.name: reference
children.formal: Identity of participant. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative.

children.name: display
children.formal: Human-readable description of the participant.

children.name: entity
children.short: An entity used in this activity
children.formal: An entity used in this activity.

children.name: role
children.formal: How the entity was used during the activity.

children.name: type
children.formal: The type of the entity. If the entity is a resource, then this is a resource type.

children.name: reference
children.formal: Identity of participant. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative.

children.name: display
children.formal: Human-readable description of the entity.

children.name: agent
children.short: Entity is attributed to this agent
children.formal: The entity is attributed to an agent to express the agent's responsibility for that entity, possibly along with other agents. This description can be understood as shorthand for saying that the agent was responsible for the activity which generated the entity.

children.name: integritySignature
children.formal: A digital signature on the target resource(s). The signature should match a Provenance.agent.reference in the provenance resource. The signature is only added to support checking cryptographic integrity of the resource, and not to represent workflow and clinical aspects of the signing process, or to support non-repudiation.
